title: Media Planning and Procurement Instruction Letter (IMIC-S520-04) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IMIC-S520-04-V02 Effective Date 02-05-2012 Update Date 12-06-2024 Related Unit / Owner MIC / Pazarlama ve Kurumsal İletişim Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim The aim of the instruction letter is to establish the rules for purchasing advertising campaigns within the framework of marketing activities. Scope This document covers the MIC-Marketing Unit, all SU units conducting advertising campaigns, and the media buying company. Advertising campaigns include all known types of advertising, including print, digital, radio, TV, outdoor, etc. Principle Conducting advertising campaigns aligned with marketing objectives in appropriate media and purchasing them in accordance with budget optimization principles. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations MIC: Marketing and Institutional Communications Directorate Regulations 1. The advertising budget for all Sabancı University units is included in the annual MIC budget plan and is determined within this framework. 2. The MIC is responsible for managing the advertising budget in line with the needs of individual units and/or institutional requirements. 3. Media procurement is conducted by a specialized media buying company. Relationships with this company are governed by an annual contract. 4. Advertising needs are determined within the framework of the annual marketing plan. They may be revised throughout the year to meet new needs. 5. The MIC communicates the advertising needs to the media buying company after consulting with the relevant unit. This request includes detailed information regarding the project's business objective, subject matter, communication objectives, intended messages, expected business results, and duration. 6. Based on this information, the media buying company submits a written proposal to the MIC, including the media, duration, type, and cost. 7. The MIC evaluates the proposal and requests revisions to the proposal if necessary. The plan is finalized after a mutual consultation. 8. MIC submits the designs for the work to be done in line with the plan to the media buying company. The company then submits the designs to the media outlets for publication. 9. Each stage of the implementation (especially for repetitive digital projects) is monitored by MIC and the media buying company. 10. Advertising campaigns are archived by MIC as they are published. 11. Advertising measurement reports are sent to MIC by the media buying company following implementation. 12. Submitted reports are stored in the MIC archive. Related Procedures Related Forms Related Form Links
